Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery open vase, probably krater. Inside glazed; outside, seated male figure, facing left, part of torso and left arm remaining; in the foreground to right an enigmatic white object, perhaps a cushion.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1156)
